title: Authors and Citation
text: Yáñez Santibáñez C (2022). auspol: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022). R package version 0.0.0.9001, https://carlosyanez.github.io/auspol/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {auspol: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022)},   author = {Carlos {Yáñez Santibáñez}},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9001},   url = {https://carlosyanez.github.io/auspol/}, }

title: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022)
text: auspol provides result data Australian Federal Elections, 2004 onwards, direclty R. Along functions access data, package also provides functions provide summaries tables plots. data contained release () Apache Parquet format, can used directly programming language/tool/platform supports Parquet.

title: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022)
text: First install required packages,, install package github Alternatively, install r-universe
code: devtools::install_github("carlosyanez/auspol") # Enable this universe options(repos = c(     carlosyanez = 'https://carlosyanez.r-universe.dev',     CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Install some packages install.packages('auspol')

title: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022)
text: find something quite right, please post issue. ideas, want contribute, please let know!

title: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022)
text: package still development. moment, contains data House Representatives.

title: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022)
text: Data sourced directly Australian Electoral Commission. Historical results Commonwealth elections published AEC’s Tally 9Room archive. functions use code written {tigris} package, maintained Kyle Walker. #  Icons made  Pixel perfect  www.flaticon.com’

what: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — plot_primary_comparison
title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — plot_primary_comparison
text: Plot historical changes primary vote electoral division (line chart)

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — plot_primary_comparison
code: plot_primary_comparison(   division = NULL,   year = NULL,   state = NULL,   label = "Candidate",   plotted_variable = "Percentage",   sort_by_value = TRUE,   extra_colours = NULL,   plot_format = "lollipop",   include_labels = FALSE,   nudge_x = 5,   parties = NULL,   parties_year = NULL,   include_others = FALSE,   include_informal = FALSE,   individualise_IND = FALSE,   include_data = TRUE,   data = NULL )

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — plot_primary_comparison
text: division Name ONE electoral division year numeric vector election years (2004), defaults . state Code one state label label results, either Candidate Name ("Name",default), Party Name ("PartyNm") Party abbreviation ("PartyAb") plotted_variable Variable plot, "OrdinaryVotes", "Percentage" (default) Percentage_with_Informal sort_by_value Whether sort results descending order (TRUE default) extra_colours manual mapping colours party, named vector. plot_format Whether plot  lollipop chart ("lollipop", default) bar chart. include_labels set TRUE, plot include value. nudge_x labels included, separation chart/dot parties parties include summary. (default), vector strings party acronyms (see list_parties()), number indicating top n parties certain year. parties_year parties NULL number, indicates selection needs certain year (.e.g select historical data three top parties 2012) include_others Boolean used along parties included remaining votes one "" category. include_informal Boolean add informal votes addition party selection. Informal votes included parties selected, top n parties selected, happens top n - even flag set false. individualise_IND set TRUE, party abbreviations independent candidate changed "IND" "IND-<<candidate's surname>>", effectively separating party aggregations. include_data set TRUE, output primary_vote_summary(), included <<output_var>>$source_data (defaults FALSE) data Alternative, instead providing parameters, possible provide data frame data plot, following format output  primary_vote_summary().

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — plot_primary_comparison
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — plot_primary_historic
text: division named vector additional colour (hex) plotted_variable Variable plot, "OrdinaryVotes", "Percentage" (default) Percentage_with_Informal parties parties include summary. (default), vector strings party acronyms (see list_parties()), number indicating top n parties certain year. parties_year parties NULL number, indicates selection needs certain year (.e.g select historical data three top parties 2012) include_others Boolean used along parties included remaining votes one "" category. include_informal Boolean add informal votes addition party selection. Informal votes included parties selected, top n parties selected, happens top n - even flag set false. individualise_IND set TRUE, party abbreviations independent candidate changed "IND" "IND-<<candidate's surname>>", effectively separating party aggregations. extra_colours manual mapping colours party, named vector. include_labels set TRUE, plot include value. year numeric vector election years (2004), defaults . include_data set TRUE, output primary_vote_summary(), included <<output_var>>$source_data (defaults FALSE) data Alternative, instead providing parameters, possible provide data frame data plot, folowing format output  primary_vote_summary().

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — plot_primary_historic
text: ggplot2 object

Informal votes included parties selected, top n parties selected, happens top n - even flag set false. individualise_IND set TRUE, party abbreviations independent candidate changed "IND" "IND-<<candidate's surname>>", effectively separating party aggregations. extra_colours manual mapping colours party, named vector. include_labels set TRUE, plot include value. year numeric vector election years (2004), defaults . data Alternative, instead providing parameters, possible provide data frame data plot, folowing format output  primary_vote_summary().

what: Helper function to download  data — primary_vote_summary
title: Helper function to download  data — primary_vote_summary
text: Helper function download  data

title: Helper function to download  data — primary_vote_summary
code: primary_vote_summary(   division = NULL,   state = NULL,   year = NULL,   parties = NULL,   parties_year = NULL,   include_others = FALSE,   include_informal = FALSE,   include_names = TRUE,   individualise_IND = FALSE,   wide_format = NULL )

title: Helper function to download  data — primary_vote_summary
text: division vector names electoral divisions (e.g. "Banks", "Wills","Indi") state divisions provide, provide vector state initials e.g. c("NT","TAS") year numeric vector election years (2004), defaults . parties parties include summary. (default), vector strings party acronyms (see list_parties()), number indicating top n parties certain year. parties_year parties NULL number, indicates selection needs certain year (.e.g select historical data three top parties 2012) include_others Boolean used along parties included remaining votes one "" category. include_informal Boolean add informal votes addition party selection. Informal votes included parties selected, top n parties selected, happens top n - even flag set false. include_names whether include candidates name surname extract (TRUE default). individualise_IND set TRUE, party abbreviations independent candidate changed "IND" "IND-<<candidate's surname>>", effectively separating party aggregations. wide_format Whether present result long format, like AEC's source, year--year summary. Options include NULL (summarisation, default), "OrdinaryVotes" (absolute numbers), "Percentage_with_Informal"  "Percentage" (percentage counted elections).

title: Helper function to download  data — primary_vote_summary
text: dataframe
